intro: Salvia officinalis f. icterina, commonly known as lemon sage, is a fragrant perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and aromatic, slightly lemon-scented leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a serrated edge, while the flowers bloom in whorls along the stems. This variety is often used in herbal teas and culinary applications due to its distinctive flavor and medicinal properties.
